snippet: The former high-ranking police officials were indicted on charges, including official misconduct and conspiracy, stemming from their actions in a theft case at a high school.
abstract: Three former high-ranking officials of the Nassau County Police Department are indicted on charges that they failed to arrest a student suspected of stealing more than $10,000 in electronic equipment from his high school because he was the son of a prominent police fund-raiser; ex-officers William Flanagan, John Hunter and Alan Sharpe all plead not guilty to charges including official misconduct and conspiracy.

byline.original: By PETER APPLEBOME and TIM STELLOH

lead_paragraph: The former high-ranking police officials were indicted on charges, including official misconduct and conspiracy, stemming from their actions in a theft case at a high school.

headline.seo: Three Ex-Nassau County Officers Charged With Misconduct
headline.main: 3 Ex-Nassau County Officers Accused of Failing to Arrest Police Fund-Raiser’s Son
headline.print_headline: 3 Ex-Nassau County Officers Accused of Failing to Arrest Police Fund-Raiser’s Son
